archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Garlic-Lime Chicken & Veg Rice Noodles (Mild)
description: Quick rice noodles tossed with tender chicken, bok choy, and crisp vegetables in a bright lime and rice vinegar finish. Light, fresh, and weeknight-fast.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil for noodles.
Trim excess fat from chicken thighs; slice into thin bite-size strips.
Slice bok choy (separate stems and leafy tops).
Slice bell pepper into thin strips.
Cut lime into wedges; set aside half for squeezing and half for serving.
Rinse and chop coriander and mint (optional garnish).
cook_steps: Cook rice noodles in boiling water according to package instructions until just tender; drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Set aside.
Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken strips with salt and black pepper; add to the skillet and stir-fry until just cooked through and lightly browned, 4–6 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
In the same skillet, add a small splash of canola oil if dry. Add garlic and bok choy stems; stir-fry 30 seconds.
Add carrots and bell pepper; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add bok choy leafy tops and spring onion; cook 1 minute until wilted.
Return chicken to the skillet. Add drained rice noodles.
Season with a big squeeze of lime and a splash of rice vinegar; toss to coat. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
Turn off heat. Sprinkle chopped coriander and mint if using. Serve with extra lime wedges.
